fields.summary: [C++] Crash when build arrow::Array using arrow::ArrayBuilder

status.name: Open

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
With ARROW-13696, you can create a MapType with non-default field names (the default being "key" and "value"). 
However, when then trying to create an array with it from python tuples, it crashes:

{code:python}
>>> t = pa.map_(pa.field("name", "string", nullable=False), "int64")
>>> pa.array([[('a', 1), ('b', 2)], [('c', 3)]], type=t)

../src/arrow/array/array_nested.cc:192:  Check failed: self->list_type_->value_type()->Equals(data->child_data[0]->type)

fields.summary: [Python] Creating a Map array with non-default field names segfaults
